channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Philippine Olympians begin quest for elusive gold
item.author: Nelson Beltran
item.description: In pursuit of a first Olympic gold medal for nearly a century now, the Philippines could finally nail it in a Summer Games like no other behind a lean but crack team bannered by a world champion gymnast, a champion golfer and a returning Olympic medalist.

item.title: PCSO to rule on appeal of disqualified bidder
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: The fate of the appeal filed by a thrice-disqualified bidder for the P6.15-billion Philippine Lottery System project is now in the hands of the Philippine Charity Sweepstakes Office special bids and awards committee.

item.title: AC Health’s specialty cancer hospital breaks ground in Taguig
item.description: Beyond boosting the private sector’s pandemic response, Ayala’s healthcare arm AC Health lives up to its goal of providing quality health care for all as it officially breaks ground for the construction of Healthway Cancer Care Center, the Philippines’ first dedicated specialty cancer hospital.

item.title: Buses for fully vaccinated commuters proposed
item.description: In a recent meeting with the transport sector, presidential adviser for entrepreneurship Joey Concepcion tossed the idea of having buses for fully vaccinated passengers to increase capacity and augment mobility as the nation reopens the economy.

item.title: Robredo lack of funds not a liability – Lagman
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: A veteran lawmaker in the House of Representatives believes Vice President Leni Robredo’s lack of funds to bankroll a possible campaign in the May 2022 presidential race may even turn in her favor.

item.title: Joint oil exploration possible if compliant with Constitution – DOE
item.author: Danessa Rivera
item.description: The joint exploration in the West Philippine Sea will push through only if compliant with the 60-40 ownership rule under the Constitution, the Department of Energy said yesterday.

item.title: DTI still reviewing price hikes for basic goods
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: The Department of Trade and Industry has clarified that it is still reviewing requests for price hikes of basic goods and assured the public that any increase won’t go beyond five percent of current price.

item.title: Experts suggest tighter measures
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: The OCTA Research Group expressed yesterday serious concern over the continuing rise of COVID-19 cases in Metro Manila, saying the region appears to be on the brink of another surge.

item.title: House to probe executive spending for pandemic
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: Invoking Congress’ power of the purse and oversight functions, Speaker Lord Allan Velasco yesterday said the House of Representatives would conduct an inquiry on how the executive department spent funds intended to fight the COVID pandemic.

item.title: No political plans in Duterte SONA
item.author: Evelyn Macairan
item.description: President Duterte is not expected to talk about his political plans during his final State of the Nation Address on July 26, Malacañang said yesterday.
